questions.question: In which situation would an ESD strike potentially cause harm to the PC?

options.A: When replacing a mechanical hard drive with an M.2 SSD
options.B: When installing an additional display in a workplace cubicle
options.C: When using a grounded mat and working on a computer on an ungrounded workbench
options.D: When installing a dual-voltage power supply

questions.explanation: Minimize the risk of electrostatic discharge. Whenever 2 things touch, there is always an exchange of electrons at the atomic level.

questions.question: A person has started a new technical job. In which situation would ESD be an issue?

options.B: When using a grounded mat and working on a computer on an ungrounded workbench
options.C: When installing a dual-voltage power supply
options.D: While exchanging one laptop AC adapter with one that is not from the original equipment manufacturer

questions.explanation: ESD is most dangerous when working with sensitive electronic components like processors.

questions.question: A laptop keyboard has a non-functioning key. A technician tests the laptop and discovers that the spring mechanism under the key is broken. What should the technician do to fix this problem?
questions.explanation: When internal keyboard components like springs are broken, the entire keyboard typically needs replacement.

questions.question: What are two advantages of purchasing a preassembled computer?

options.A: Easy to customize the installed components
options.B: Always has the best and latest technology installed
options.D: Has been properly tested before purchase
options.E: Easy to customize the installed software

questions.explanation: Preassembled computers typically come with extended warranties and have been tested before sale.

questions.question: A mobile device user has entered the wrong passcode on a mobile device too many times and now the device is locked. What should the user do?

options.A: Wait a specific period of time indicated by the mobile device before attempting the passcode again
options.B: Remove the battery from the mobile device for 10 seconds to restart the device
options.C: Call the device provider to request that the device be unlocked
options.D: Turn the mobile device off and back on to unlock the mobile device

questions.explanation: Mobile devices typically implement lockout periods that require waiting before attempting the passcode again.

questions.question: Two different mobile devices are having problems synchronizing email and contacts. What are two possible causes?

options.A: The location services are not enabled
options.B: The mobile devices are using different operating systems
options.C: The date and time are not correctly configured
options.D: The screen orientation settings are not configured properly
options.E: The synchronization software is not compatible

questions.explanation: Synchronization issues often stem from incorrect date/time settings or incompatible synchronization software.

questions.question: What is an advantage of using an inkjet printer?

options.C: Able to print on various types of paper

questions.explanation: Inkjet printers can handle various paper types including photo paper, transparencies, and specialty media.

questions.question: An employee reports that each time a workstation is started, it locks up after about 5 minutes of use. What is the most likely cause?

options.D: The CPU is not compatible with the motherboard

questions.explanation: Consistent lockups after a specific time period typically indicate overheating issues.

questions.question: How does an inline UPS work?

options.A: It filters power through the battery before delivery to the computer
options.B: It provides power to the computer by switching between utility power and battery power
options.C: It provides power to the computer from the utility and uses the battery to charge a capacitor
options.D: It filters the power through a transformer before delivery to the computer

questions.explanation: An inline UPS continuously filters power through the battery, providing clean, regulated power.

questions.question: What does the Windows 10 command gpupdate do?

options.A: It updates the video card drivers
options.B: It forces an immediate update of all group policies
options.C: It forces an immediate update of Windows
options.D: It updates the drivers for all hardware devices

questions.explanation: The gpupdate command forces an immediate refresh of group policy settings.

questions.question: When responding to a call from a customer who is experiencing problems with a computer, the technician notices that a number of system files on the computer have been renamed. Which two possible solutions could the technician implement to resolve the problem?

options.A: Use antivirus software to remove a virus
options.B: Restore the computer from a backup
options.C: Change the folder and file permissions of the user
options.D: Reset the password of the user

questions.explanation: Renamed system files are usually the result of a virus on the computer. Removing the virus and restoring the computer from a backup are the only two possible solutions in this case.

questions.question: A technician suspects that a security issue is causing problems with a computer. What two actions could be performed to test theories of probable cause when troubleshooting the PC?

options.A: Log in as a different user
options.B: Disconnect the computer from the network
options.C: Search helpdesk repair logs for more information
options.E: Ask the customer open-ended questions about the problem

questions.explanation: Several actions can be taken by a technician when security issues are suspected as the possible cause of a problem with a computer. Logging in as a different user or disconnecting the PC from the network to isolate the cause of the problem are two possible actions.

questions.question: A computer suddenly shuts down, but immediately restarts normally. Which two hardware components should be checked first when troubleshooting this problem?
questions.explanation: Sudden shutdowns with immediate restarts often indicate overheating (CPU) or power supply issues.

questions.question: A technician is troubleshooting a Windows 10 PC that is experiencing slow performance. Which two tools can be used to analyze the problem?
questions.explanation: Task Manager and Performance Monitor are primary tools for analyzing system performance issues in Windows 10.

questions.question: A technician configures a RAID 1 array for a customer. If one drive in the array fails, what happens to the data?

options.B: Data remains accessible from the remaining drive
options.D: Data needs to be restored from backup

questions.explanation: RAID 1 provides mirroring, so if one drive fails, data remains accessible from the remaining drive.

notes: This represents a sample extraction from ITExamAnswers.net
Full database contains 117+ questions across all chapters
Questions include single and multiple correct answers
Additional practice exams available for each module
